channel.title: Twitter on vCO Team
channel.description: Recent content in Twitter on vCO Team

item.title: Dynamic Types tutorial : Implement your own Twitter plug-in without any scripting
item.description: In a previous article I have explained how the vCO dynamic Types allow to simplify the development of vCO plug-ins and how these are leveraged by VMware vCloud Automation Center XaaS. It is now time to experiment with creating a plugin with leveraging the Dynamic Types plug-in generator package. Warning: You can do it without Java development experience and without having to write a single line of scripting ! As a first step download the Dynamic Types plug-in generator package from VMware communities.

item.title: Tutorial: Create your own Twitter Application with a vCO workflow in a few minutes
item.description: If you thought vCO was powerful, think again. The new SOAP and REST plug-in are taking it to new levels. With the following tutorial you can in as little as 30 minutes and without a single line of code (yes really !) create a workflow that will update your Twitter status. If you never had a chance to do a vCO Tutorial this one is really an easy one for starting.
